body_html:
• reciprocal looks good
  • sqrt looks good (the version with rsqrt is better)
  • acos + asin looks good
  • div - I'm not sure about this. It would be best to use this version for the regular op, and the one we have right now for the in-place version. I don't think it's possible to do with with our current codegen, as in-place versions are automatically generated from regular definitions (or am I wrong @colesbury?)
body_text:
reciprocal looks good
sqrt looks good (the version with rsqrt is better)
acos + asin looks good
div - I'm not sure about this. It would be best to use this version for the regular op, and the one we have right now for the in-place version. I don't think it's possible to do with with our current codegen, as in-place versions are automatically generated from regular definitions (or am I wrong @colesbury?)
body:
* `reciprocal` looks good
* `sqrt` looks good (the version with rsqrt is better)
* `acos` + `asin` looks good
* `div` - I'm not sure about this. It would be best to use this version for the regular op, and the one we have right now for the in-place version. I don't think it's possible to do with with our current codegen, as in-place versions are automatically generated from regular definitions (or am I wrong @colesbury?)
